wiki_catalogs.name: Introduction
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the introduction section focused on the skills repository. Explain the purpose of the repository as a collection of modular skills that extend Claude's AI capabilities. Describe the overall vision, target audience (developers, AI engineers, technical writers), and primary use cases such as document processing, creative generation, and enterprise automation. Provide a high-level overview of the skills ecosystem, including how skills are structured, loaded, and used. Highlight key benefits like reusability, consistency, and extensibility. Use terminology consistent with the codebase (e.g., SKILL.md, MCP, artifacts). Include practical examples of skill applications and illustrate the relationship between different skill categories. Address architectural principles like plugin-based design and configuration-driven behavior.

wiki_catalogs.name: Skill Metadata and YAML Frontmatter
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the skill metadata system focused on the YAML frontmatter in SKILL.md files. Explain the purpose and structure of the required fields (name, description) and optional fields (license, allowed-tools, metadata). Detail the constraints for each field, such as the name being in hyphen-case and matching the directory name. Provide examples from actual skills like 'algorithmic-art' and 'artifacts-builder' to illustrate proper usage. Document how the metadata is used by the Claude system for skill discovery and loading. Include validation guidelines and common errors to avoid, such as incorrect naming conventions or missing required fields. Address integration with the broader skill architecture and how metadata influences tool permissions and client behavior.

wiki_catalogs.name: Plugin Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the plugin architecture that enables modular skill loading in Claude. Explain how each skill directory acts as a self-contained plugin with a SKILL.md entrypoint, using the agent_skills_spec.md specification. Detail the directory structure requirements and the role of the YAML frontmatter in defining skill metadata. Provide examples from the codebase such as how algorithmic-art and document-skills follow this pattern. Document the discovery and loading mechanism, including how skills are registered and activated. Address common issues like incorrect naming conventions or missing SKILL.md files. Include best practices for organizing plugin components and ensuring compatibility with the core system.

wiki_catalogs.name: Algorithmic Art
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the algorithmic-art skill. Explain its implementation using p5.js for generative art creation, including the use of seeded randomness to ensure reproducible outputs. Document the structure and functionality of the generator_template.js and viewer.html files, showing how they enable interactive parameter controls and real-time rendering. Provide practical examples of creating flow fields, particle systems, and geometric patterns. Describe integration with the core skill system and how parameters are passed from the SKILL.md configuration. Address common issues such as canvas rendering failures or inconsistent randomness, and provide debugging strategies. Include performance optimization tips for complex animations and guidance on extending the template with custom visual effects.

wiki_catalogs.name: Artifacts Builder
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the artifacts-builder skill. Thoroughly explain its implementation for generating interactive HTML artifacts using React, Tailwind CSS, and shadcn/ui components. Document the workflow from initialization via init-artifact.sh to bundling with bundle-artifact.sh, including directory structure setup and dependency management. Include concrete examples of creating responsive UI components and integrating modern frontend libraries. Explain how this skill interfaces with Claude to dynamically generate production-ready frontend code. Address configuration options, common issues such as build failures or dependency conflicts, and performance optimization strategies for lightweight artifact generation. Provide guidance on customization and extension of the build pipeline.

wiki_catalogs.name: Brand Guidelines
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the brand-guidelines skill. Explain how this skill enforces brand consistency by applying predefined color palettes and typography standards to generated artifacts. Document the structure of the SKILL.md file and how it defines brand rules. Include practical examples of applying brand colors and fonts to documents and HTML artifacts. Describe integration points with other skills such as artifacts-builder and theme-factory. Address common issues like incorrect color application or font substitution and provide troubleshooting steps. Explain customization options for defining new brand guidelines and validating compliance.

wiki_catalogs.name: DOCX Processing
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for DOCX processing skill. Thoroughly explain implementation details of OOXML manipulation, including document unpacking, modification, and repackaging using Python scripts. Document the use of OOXML schemas for structure validation and compliance. Explain tracked changes, comments, and redlining implementation with practical examples from the codebase. Describe integration with JavaScript via docx-js.md for hybrid workflows. Include usage patterns for template-based document generation and automation. Address common issues such as formatting loss during round-trip processing and provide solutions. Cover security considerations when handling sensitive Word documents and best practices for preserving metadata integrity.

wiki_catalogs.name: Skill Creation Tools
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the skill creation tools sub-component. Thoroughly explain the implementation and usage of each tool: init_skill.py for bootstrapping new skills with proper directory structure and templated files, package_skill.py for creating distributable zip packages after validation, and quick_validate.py for enforcing structural and naming conventions. Include concrete examples from the codebase such as how init_skill.py generates SKILL.md with YAML frontmatter and resource directories, how package_skill.py integrates validation before packaging, and the specific checks performed by quick_validate.py (YAML frontmatter, name format, description rules). Document the invocation relationships between these tools in the development workflow. Explain common issues like invalid skill names or missing SKILL.md and their solutions. Address configuration options such as output directory specification in packaging and provide best practices for maintaining skill quality through this toolchain.

wiki_catalogs.name: Skill Specification
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the Agent Skills Specification. Detail the complete structure of a skill folder, including the mandatory SKILL.md file and optional components. Explain the YAML frontmatter requirements with precise specifications for the required fields (name, description) and optional fields (license, allowed-tools, metadata), including data types, constraints, and validation rules. Provide concrete examples of properly formatted SKILL.md files from the codebase, such as those found in algorithmic-art/SKILL.md and artifacts-builder/SKILL.md. Document the relationship between the skill directory name and the 'name' field requirement. Explain the purpose and flexibility of the Markdown body section. Include guidance on best practices for writing effective skill descriptions and metadata. Address common implementation errors and validation issues that developers might encounter when creating skills.

wiki_catalogs.name: Getting Started
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the getting started section focused on onboarding new users to the skills framework. Explain step-by-step how to explore, install, and use existing skills from the repository. Provide clear instructions on how to load a skill into Claude, configure it via YAML frontmatter, and invoke its functionality. Include a tutorial on creating a first custom skill using the template-skill as a foundation. Document the minimal required fields in SKILL.md and demonstrate basic customization. Use practical examples from the template-skill and real skill implementations. Explain how to validate a skill using the skill-creator tools. Address common setup issues and provide troubleshooting tips for configuration errors. Make the content accessible to beginners while laying the groundwork for advanced usage.

wiki_catalogs.name: Skill Directory Layout and Conventions
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the skill directory structure, explaining the minimal and extended layouts. Describe the mandatory SKILL.md file as the entry point and the optional components such as scripts, templates, and resources. Use examples from 'algorithmic-art' with its templates directory and 'artifacts-builder' with its shell scripts to demonstrate different organizational patterns. Explain the purpose of each common subdirectory (scripts, templates, resources) and file type (LICENSE.txt, configuration files). Document naming conventions, file placement best practices, and how directory structure supports functionality like artifact generation or document processing. Address how the structure enables reuse, maintainability, and clarity for developers creating new skills.

wiki_catalogs.name: Dynamic Skill Loading
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for dynamic skill loading, explaining how Claude discovers and loads skills at runtime based on user requests. Cover the lifecycle from skill detection to activation and deactivation. Use examples from the repository such as how installing document-skills via the plugin marketplace triggers dynamic loading. Explain the role of the SKILL.md file in enabling this behavior and how metadata influences loading decisions. Document integration points with Claude Code, Claude.ai, and the API. Address common issues like failed loading due to malformed YAML or network errors in remote repositories. Provide troubleshooting guidance and performance considerations for minimizing latency during skill activation.

wiki_catalogs.name: Canvas Design
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the canvas-design skill. Explain its role in creating styled visual artifacts in PNG and PDF formats, focusing on typography management through the included font library. Document the licensing and usage of each Open Font License (OFL) font in the canvas-fonts directory. Provide practical examples of applying typographic hierarchy, font pairing, and layout design within generated visuals. Describe how font selection integrates with theme-based styling from the theme-factory skill. Address common issues such as font rendering inconsistencies across platforms or missing glyph errors, and provide solutions. Include best practices for optimizing text legibility and visual impact in static designs.

wiki_catalogs.name: MCP Builder
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the mcp-builder skill. Thoroughly explain its implementation for creating MCP servers that enable integration between Claude and external APIs. Document the architecture of both Node.js and Python-based MCP servers, including connection handling in connections.py and evaluation logic in evaluation.py. Include concrete examples from example_evaluation.xml and requirements.txt to illustrate configuration and deployment patterns. Explain how this skill enables secure, reliable API communication and supports evaluation workflows. Address best practices from mcp_best_practices.md, common issues such as authentication failures or timeout errors, and performance considerations for low-latency integrations. Provide guidance on extending the server implementations for custom API endpoints.

wiki_catalogs.name: Internal Communications
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the internal-comms skill. Explain how this skill generates professional internal communications such as newsletters, status updates, and FAQs. Document the example templates provided and their use cases. Include practical examples of generating a company newsletter or FAQ response using the skill. Describe how the skill ensures tone consistency and information clarity. Address common issues like inappropriate tone or missing information and provide solutions. Explain how to customize templates and create new communication types while maintaining organizational standards.

wiki_catalogs.name: PDF Processing
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for PDF processing skill. Thoroughly explain implementation details of PDF manipulation, including form field detection, bounding box analysis, and programmatic form filling. Document the use of PyPDF2 or similar libraries for extraction and modification tasks. Explain workflows for converting PDFs to images for validation and annotation overlay. Include concrete examples from the codebase such as fill_pdf_form_with_annotations.py for advanced use cases. Describe usage patterns for automated data entry, compliance checks, and document verification. Address common issues like font embedding problems or form field compatibility across readers and provide solutions. Cover security considerations when processing confidential PDFs and strategies for maintaining document integrity.

wiki_catalogs.name: Skill Templating
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the skill templating sub-component. Explain the role of template-skill as the foundational blueprint for new skill development, focusing on its minimal structure with required YAML frontmatter (name, description) and markdown skeleton. Analyze how this template enforces consistency across the skills ecosystem by providing the mandatory metadata format and basic document structure. Include concrete examples from the actual template showing the placeholder values and required format. Document how this template integrates with the skill creation tools, particularly how init_skill.py uses it as a basis for new skills. Explain the relationship between this template and the validation rules in quick_validate.py regarding naming conventions and metadata requirements. Address common issues such as incomplete template customization or deviation from the expected structure, and provide best practices for extending the template while maintaining compatibility with the broader system.

wiki_catalogs.name: Licensing and Compliance
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive licensing documentation detailing all third-party dependencies and their compliance requirements. Catalog each third-party component listed in THIRD_PARTY_NOTICES.md, including FFmpeg 7.0.2 (GPLv3), Pillow 11.3.0 (MIT-CMU), imageio 2.37.0 (BSD 2-Clause), and all fonts under SIL Open Font License v1.1. For each component, provide the exact license text, copyright holders, and specific compliance obligations such as source code distribution requirements, attribution notices, and redistribution terms. Detail the implications of each license type (copyleft vs permissive) for skill developers. Provide practical guidance on how to properly attribute each dependency in derivative works. Include specific instructions for handling the SIL Open Font License requirements for the 25 fonts in canvas-design/canvas-fonts. Document any potential license conflicts and mitigation strategies. Explain the process for adding new dependencies while maintaining compliance.

wiki_catalogs.name: Skill Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the skill format and structure. Describe the high-level design of a skill as a self-contained module with a SKILL.md entry point, optional scripts, and resources. Document the required and optional components of a skill directory, including licensing, metadata, and implementation code. Explain the role of YAML frontmatter in defining skill metadata (name, description, license, parameters). Illustrate the plugin architecture and dynamic loading mechanism used by Claude to integrate skills. Detail the directory structure conventions and naming standards. Include system context diagrams showing how skills interact with the core AI system. Address cross-cutting concerns like versioning, dependency management, and security isolation between skills.

wiki_catalogs.name: Dynamic Skill Loading and Plugin Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the dynamic skill loading mechanism used by Claude. Describe how the system discovers skills through the presence of SKILL.md files and loads them as self-contained modules. Explain the plugin architecture that allows skills to extend Claude's capabilities without tight coupling. Illustrate the lifecycle of a skill from discovery to execution, including metadata parsing, resource loading, and runtime integration. Use examples from algorithmic-art's interactive HTML generation and artifacts-builder's React-based artifact creation to show how different skills are loaded and executed. Address security considerations such as sandboxing, dependency isolation, and allowed-tools restrictions. Include performance implications of dynamic loading and strategies for efficient skill management.

wiki_catalogs.name: Template-Based Generation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for template-based generation, a core pattern used across multiple skills. Explain how templates provide consistent output structures while allowing parameterization, using concrete examples like the p5.js templates in algorithmic-art and animation templates in slack-gif-creator. Document the template loading process, variable injection mechanism, and rendering pipeline. Show how templates enable rapid generation of artifacts while maintaining brand or structural consistency. Address common issues such as template resolution failures or parameter mismatches. Provide best practices for designing reusable templates and organizing template hierarchies. Include performance tips for optimizing template compilation and caching.

wiki_catalogs.name: Slack GIF Creator
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the slack-gif-creator skill. Explain its implementation for generating animated GIFs optimized for Slack, including the core modules: color_palettes.py for brand-aligned coloring, easing.py for animation timing, frame_composer.py for frame assembly, gif_builder.py for final export, typography.py for text rendering, validators.py for input validation, and visual_effects.py for effect application. Document the 13 animation templates (bounce, explode, fade, etc.) and how they can be combined for complex sequences. Provide practical examples of creating attention-grabbing Slack messages with branded animations. Describe integration with brand-guidelines and theme-factory skills for consistent styling. Address common issues such as large file sizes, animation stuttering, or color distortion, and provide optimization techniques including frame rate adjustment and palette reduction. Include guidance on extending the system with custom animation templates.

wiki_catalogs.name: Web Application Testing
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the webapp-testing skill. Thoroughly explain its implementation using Playwright for browser automation and UI verification. Document the test execution workflow, including server interaction via with_server.py and practical testing patterns demonstrated in console_logging.py, element_discovery.py, and static_html_automation.py. Include concrete examples of writing robust test scripts, handling dynamic content, and debugging test failures. Explain how this skill enables reliable end-to-end testing of web applications when integrated with Claude. Address common issues such as flaky tests or element locator failures, and provide performance optimization tips for efficient test execution. Cover best practices for test organization and maintenance.

wiki_catalogs.name: Theme Factory
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the theme-factory skill. Explain how this skill applies professional themes to artifacts to ensure visual consistency and polish. Document the available themes such as Arctic Frost, Botanical Garden, and Tech Innovation, and their design characteristics. Include practical examples of applying themes to HTML artifacts, documents, and presentations. Describe how themes are structured in markdown files and how they define color schemes, spacing, and layout rules. Address common issues like theme application failures or visual inconsistencies across formats and provide debugging guidance. Explain how to create custom themes and integrate them with the skill.

wiki_catalogs.name: PPTX Processing
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for PPTX processing skill. Thoroughly explain implementation details of PowerPoint manipulation using OOXML standards, including slide unpacking, content modification, and reassembly. Document the html2pptx.js conversion tool that transforms HTML content into structured presentations with styling preservation. Explain slide inventory management, layout rearrangement, and text replacement workflows. Include concrete examples from scripts like rearrange.py and replace.py to demonstrate automation capabilities. Describe thumbnail generation for preview systems. Address common issues such as animation loss or font substitution and provide mitigation strategies. Cover integration patterns between HTML templates and PPTX output for enterprise reporting use cases.

wiki_catalogs.name: Core Concepts
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the core concepts section that underpins the entire skills framework. Thoroughly explain key architectural patterns including plugin architecture, dynamic skill loading, template-based generation, and configuration-driven behavior. For each concept, provide concrete examples from the codebase (e.g., how algorithmic-art uses templates, how document-skills use configuration). Explain the benefits and trade-offs of these design choices. Document the data flow from user request to skill execution and output generation. Include usage patterns for parameterized skills and demonstrate how configuration affects behavior. Address common issues like configuration errors or template resolution failures. Provide best practices for leveraging these concepts when developing new skills.

wiki_catalogs.name: Configuration-Driven Behavior
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for configuration-driven behavior, where skill functionality is controlled through declarative configuration rather than hardcoded logic. Explain how YAML frontmatter in SKILL.md files defines behavior parameters and constraints, using examples like theme-factory's theme selection and document-skills' format preservation settings. Document how configuration affects execution flow, resource selection, and output generation. Show how this approach enables flexibility without requiring code changes. Address common issues like invalid configuration values or missing required fields. Provide best practices for designing intuitive configuration schemas and validating inputs. Include examples of advanced configurations from the document-skills and mcp-builder modules.

wiki_catalogs.name: XLSX Processing
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for XLSX processing skill. Thoroughly explain implementation details of Excel spreadsheet manipulation, focusing on formula preservation and recalculation logic implemented in recalc.py. Document the OOXML-based structure of XLSX files and how worksheets, cells, and formulas are represented. Explain usage patterns for automated financial modeling, data analysis, and report generation. Include practical examples of reading, modifying, and recalculating complex spreadsheets programmatically. Address common issues such as floating-point precision errors, circular reference handling, and compatibility with different Excel versions. Provide best practices for maintaining calculation integrity when automating spreadsheet workflows and ensuring auditability of changes.

wiki_catalogs.name: Creative & Design Skills
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the creative and design skills category. Explain the purpose of these skills in generating visual content such as generative art, animated GIFs, and styled documents. Document the implementation details of each skill: algorithmic-art's use of p5.js and seeded randomness, canvas-design's font management and visual styling, and slack-gif-creator's animation primitives and optimization techniques. Include practical examples of how to use these skills to create engaging visual content. Explain the relationship between these skills and their dependencies (e.g., p5.js, React). Address performance considerations for rendering complex visuals and provide optimization tips. Document common issues like animation glitches or font rendering problems and their solutions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Document Processing Skills
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the document processing skills category. Explain the purpose of these skills in creating, editing, and manipulating various document formats including DOCX, PDF, PPTX, and XLSX. Document the implementation details of each skill: docx's OOXML manipulation and tracked changes, pdf's form filling and text extraction, pptx's slide management and html2pptx conversion, and xlsx's formula support and recalculation. Include practical examples of how to use these skills for common document automation tasks. Explain the shared OOXML foundation and how it enables consistent document manipulation across formats. Address security considerations when processing sensitive documents and provide best practices for data integrity. Document common issues like formatting loss or compatibility problems and their solutions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Development & Technical Skills
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the development and technical skills category. Explain the purpose of these skills in supporting software development workflows such as artifact creation, API integration, and web testing. Document the implementation details of each skill: artifacts-builder's React and Tailwind CSS integration for HTML artifact generation, mcp-builder's MCP server creation for external API connectivity, and webapp-testing's Playwright-based browser automation. Include practical examples of how to use these skills to build interactive web components, integrate with external services, and automate UI testing. Explain the technology stack and dependencies for each skill. Address performance considerations for building optimized artifacts and reliable test automation. Document common issues like dependency conflicts or test flakiness and their solutions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Enterprise & Communication Skills
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the enterprise and communication skills category. Explain the purpose of these skills in maintaining brand consistency and facilitating organizational communication. Document the implementation details of each skill: brand-guidelines' enforcement of color and typography standards, internal-comms' generation of newsletters and FAQs, and theme-factory's application of professional themes to artifacts. Include practical examples of how to use these skills to create on-brand communications and styled documents. Explain how these skills integrate with other modules (e.g., applying themes to artifacts). Address challenges in maintaining consistency across different output formats and provide guidelines for customization. Document common issues like brand guideline violations or theme application failures and their solutions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Meta Skills
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the meta skills category. Explain the purpose of these skills in enabling the creation and management of other skills. Document the implementation details of each meta skill: skill-creator's tooling for initializing, packaging, and validating skills, and template-skill's role as a starting point for new skill development. Include practical examples of how to use these tools to bootstrap new skills and ensure they meet quality standards. Explain the validation process and common errors detected by quick_validate.py. Provide best practices for structuring new skills and maintaining consistency with existing ones. Address common issues in skill creation like missing metadata or invalid configurations and their solutions. Make this content essential for developers looking to extend the skills ecosystem.

wiki_catalogs.name: Advanced Topics
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for advanced topics in skill development and deployment. Cover custom skill development beyond the template, performance optimization techniques for computationally intensive skills, robust error handling patterns, and security considerations for handling sensitive data. Discuss advanced configuration options and extension points in the skills framework. Address scalability challenges when managing large numbers of skills and provide strategies for organization and discovery. Include guidance on integrating with external systems via MCP servers and handling authentication securely. Document best practices for maintaining backward compatibility and versioning skills. Provide real-world examples from complex skills in the repository to illustrate these concepts.

wiki_catalogs.name: Reference
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive reference material for the skills framework. Document the complete agent_skills_spec.md specification including all supported YAML frontmatter fields, their data types, constraints, and usage examples. Provide a complete listing of third-party dependencies and their licenses from THIRD_PARTY_NOTICES.md, with guidance on compliance requirements. Include API reference for any programmatic interfaces (e.g., skill validation scripts, MCP server APIs). Document configuration options, environment variables, and command-line tools. Organize the reference material for quick lookup with clear categorization and searchability. Include cross-references to related conceptual documentation. Ensure the reference is accurate, complete, and reflects the current state of the codebase.

wiki_catalogs.name: Troubleshooting
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive troubleshooting content for common issues encountered when using and developing skills. Document error patterns and their root causes, such as configuration errors, missing dependencies, template resolution failures, and permission issues. Provide step-by-step debugging techniques and diagnostic tools available in the framework (e.g., validation scripts). Include solutions for specific problems like malformed YAML, broken script paths, or incompatible dependencies. Address environment-specific issues and provide platform-specific guidance. Organize the content by symptom and impact level. Include preventive measures and best practices to avoid common pitfalls. Make this section actionable with clear resolution steps and examples from real issues in the codebase.

wiki_items.title: Dynamic Skill Loading and Plugin Architecture

wiki_overview.content:
<blog>
# Comprehensive Project Analysis: Skills Repository

## 1. Project Introduction

### Purpose Statement
This repository contains a collection of example skills that extend Claude's capabilities for specialized tasks. Skills are self-contained directories with instructions, scripts, and resources that teach Claude how to complete specific tasks in a repeatable way, whether creating documents with brand guidelines, analyzing data using organizational workflows, or automating personal tasks.

### Core Goals and Objectives
The primary goal is to demonstrate the versatility of Claude's skills system through reference examples spanning creative applications, technical tasks, and enterprise workflows. These skills enable Claude to perform specialized operations by loading dynamic instructions and tools when needed.

### Target Audience
The repository targets developers, AI practitioners, and organizations looking to extend Claude's capabilities through custom skills. It serves as both an educational resource and inspiration for building domain-specific skills that enhance AI performance on specialized tasks.

## 2. Technical Architecture

### Component Breakdown
The project follows a modular monorepo structure where each skill is an independent component with its own functionality. The architecture consists of:

- **Creative & Design Skills**: algorithmic-art, canvas-design, slack-gif-creator
- **Document Processing Skills**: docx, pdf, pptx, xlsx
- **Development & Technical Skills**: artifacts-builder, mcp-builder, webapp-testing
- **Enterprise & Communication Skills**: brand-guidelines, internal-comms, theme-factory
- **Meta Skills**: skill-creator, template-skill

### Design Patterns
The project employs several key design patterns:

- **Plugin Architecture**: Each skill operates as a pluggable module that can be dynamically loaded
- **Template-Based Generation**: Skills use templates to ensure consistent output formats
- **Separation of Concerns**: Clear division between skill definition (SKILL.md), implementation code, and resources
- **Configuration-Driven Behavior**: YAML frontmatter in SKILL.md files defines skill metadata and behavior

### System Relationships
```mermaid
flowchart TD
    A[User Request] --> B{Skill Router}
    B --> C[Creative Skills]
    B --> D[Document Skills]
    B --> E[Technical Skills]
    B --> F[Enterprise Skills]
    C --> G[algorithmic-art]
    C --> H[canvas-design]
    C --> I[slack-gif-creator]
    D --> J[docx]
    D --> K[pdf]
    D --> L[pptx]
    D --> M[xlsx]
    E --> N[artifacts-builder]
    E --> O[mcp-builder]
    E --> P[webapp-testing]
    F --> Q[brand-guidelines]
    F --> R[internal-comms]
    F --> S[theme-factory]
```

### Data Flow
```mermaid
flowchart TD
    A[User Input] --> B[Skill Selection]
    B --> C[Skill Configuration]
    C --> D[Template Loading]
    D --> E[Parameter Processing]
    E --> F[Content Generation]
    F --> G[Output Rendering]
    G --> H[User Interface]
```

## 3. Key Implementation

### Main Entry Points
- `README.md` - Project overview and usage instructions
- `agent_skills_spec.md` - Specification for skill format and structure
- `SKILL.md` files - Entry points for individual skills

### Core Modules
- `algorithmic-art/templates/viewer.html` - Interactive generative art template
- `artifacts-builder/scripts/init-artifact.sh` - React project initialization
- `artifacts-builder/scripts/bundle-artifact.sh` - Artifact bundling script
- `document-skills/docx/ooxml/scripts/unpack.py` - OOXML document unpacking
- `document-skills/docx/ooxml/scripts/pack.py` - OOXML document packing

### Configuration Approach
- `SKILL.md` files with YAML frontmatter for skill metadata
- `.gitignore` for version control configuration
- `THIRD_PARTY_NOTICES.md` for dependency attribution

### External Dependencies
- `THIRD_PARTY_NOTICES.md` - Third-party software attributions
- `slack-gif-creator/requirements.txt` - Python dependencies
- `mcp-builder/scripts/requirements.txt` - MCP server dependencies

### Integration Points
- `artifacts-builder` - Integration with React, Tailwind CSS, and shadcn/ui
- `document-skills` - Integration with OOXML, pandoc, and LibreOffice
- `webapp-testing` - Integration with Playwright for UI testing

### Component Relationships
```mermaid
graph TD
    A[Core Framework] --> B[algorithmic-art]
    A --> C[artifacts-builder]
    A --> D[document-skills]
    A --> E[slack-gif-creator]
    A --> F[theme-factory]
    B --> G[p5.js]
    C --> H[React]
    C --> I[Tailwind CSS]
    C --> J[shadcn/ui]
    D --> K[OOXML]
    D --> L[pandoc]
    E --> M[Pillow]
    E --> N[imageio]
    F --> O[Design Themes]
```

## 4. Key Features

### Functionality Overview
The repository provides a comprehensive set of skills across multiple domains:

- **Generative Art**: Creating algorithmic art with p5.js and interactive parameters
- **Document Processing**: Advanced manipulation of DOCX, PDF, PPTX, and XLSX files
- **Artifact Creation**: Building complex HTML artifacts with modern frontend technologies
- **Brand Consistency**: Applying consistent branding across generated content
- **Testing Capabilities**: Web application testing with Playwright

### Implementation Highlights
- **Dynamic Skill Loading**: Skills are loaded based on user requests and context
- **Interactive Artifacts**: Self-contained HTML files with parameter controls
- **Document Fidelity**: Preservation of formatting, tracked changes, and comments
- **Template Standardization**: Consistent UI patterns across different skills
- **Batch Processing**: Efficient handling of multiple document changes

### Feature Architecture
```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
    [*] --> Idle
    Idle --> SkillSelection: User Request
    SkillSelection --> Configuration: Skill Matched
    Configuration --> ContentGeneration: Parameters Set
    ContentGeneration --> OutputRendering: Processing Complete
    OutputRendering --> InteractiveMode: Artifact Displayed
    InteractiveMode --> ContentGeneration: Parameter Change
    OutputRendering --> [*]: Complete
```
Sources:
- [README.md](c:\Users\hfeng1\skills\README.md)
- [agent_skills_spec.md](c:\Users\hfeng1\skills\agent_skills_spec.md)
